result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacqueline Ann Schuman

defendant.name: Schuman, Jacqueline Ann
defendant.address: 715 Cloud St; Po Box 1266, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:20 AM ADA Fuhr calls case and states appearances. Defendant Jacqueline Ann Schuman appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Jacqueline Ann Schuman.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Restemayer comments and states that an offer has been proposed and requests this matter be set for plea and sentencing. ADA Fuhr gives date of 11/21/2022 at 11:30 AM for a Plea and Sentencing.
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacqueline Ann Schuman appeared by phone. Defendant states she did not receive the criminal complaint. Court recites charges and maximum penalties on record for the defendant. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Notice of right to attorney given to DE. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Bond recommendations stated by DA Kelz. Bond ordered as requested. Defendant updates address on record. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
